meanings.definition: The dry outer covering of some fruits or seeds.
meanings.sent1: The farmer collected the corn husk to use as animal bedding.
meanings.sent2: She peeled the husk off the corn before cooking it.
meanings.sent3: The squirrel used the corn husk as a tiny umbrella during the rain.
meanings.sent4: The husk of the coconut protected the sweet fruit inside.
meanings.sent5: The husk of the walnut cracked easily under pressure.

meanings.definition: To remove the outer covering from a fruit or seed.
meanings.sent1: He carefully husked the coconut to reveal the white flesh inside.
meanings.sent2: She husked the peas before cooking them for dinner.
meanings.sent3: The kids giggled as they tried to husk the oranges without making a mess.
meanings.sent4: The gardener husked the sunflower seeds to save for planting next season.
meanings.sent5: The chef husked the corn quickly and efficiently.

meanings.sent1: The old barn was just a husk of its former self.
meanings.sent2: The abandoned building was nothing but a husk of its former glory.
meanings.sent3: The empty husk of the peanut shell lay discarded on the ground.
meanings.sent4: The burnt husk of the tree stood as a reminder of the forest fire.
meanings.sent5: The husk of the popcorn kernels was left at the bottom of the bowl.
